name: claque
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a group of people who admire and support a person very strongly and agree with what he or she says or does: Even in her darkest hours Margaret Thatcher had her passionate advocates, her loud claque of admirers.
in the past, a group of people who were paid to applaud (= show approval of) a performer or performers, for example in the theatre: Such people are the 21st-century equivalent of the claque, paid not with cash but with an invitation to the post-show party.
